meanings.definition: To make a shrill, piercing sound
meanings.sent1: The kettle was skreighing on the stove, signaling that the water was boiling.
meanings.sent2: The cat started skreighing when it saw a mouse scurrying across the floor.
meanings.sent3: The baby found the squeaky toy and began skreighing with delight.
meanings.sent4: The wind skreighing through the trees sounded like a banshee's wail.
meanings.sent5: The brakes of the car skreighing to a halt startled the pedestrians.

meanings.definition: To cry out loudly or harshly
meanings.sent1: The child skreighing for his favorite toy in the store drew everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The man skreighing for help after falling into the icy water was rescued just in time.
meanings.sent3: The parrot skreighing 'Polly wants a cracker!' amused the visitors at the zoo.
meanings.sent4: The protester skreighing slogans through the megaphone echoed across the square.
meanings.sent5: The actor skreighing his lines on stage made the audience burst into laughter.

meanings.definition: A loud, shrill cry or sound
meanings.sent1: The skreighing of the seagulls overhead filled the beach with noise.
meanings.sent2: The skreighing of the fire alarm sent everyone rushing out of the building.
meanings.sent3: The skreighing of the violin during the concert was both beautiful and haunting.
meanings.sent4: The skreighing of the brakes on the old car made everyone cringe.
meanings.sent5: The skreighing of the microphone feedback interrupted the singer's performance.
